div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 177 Carystus, Euboea, c. 1945 Burial: c. 230 B.C. (Wallace) Contents: c. 378 AR Lot A Alexander III: 2 early post. tetradr. (Babylon 1, unc. 1) 3 dr. (Asia Minor mints) Carystus: 37 didr.; 8 dr. Euboean League: 1 tetradr. 30 dr. (incl. 1 anc. for- gery) Athens: 6 tetradr. Elis: 2 st. Seleucus I: 2 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim, Ecbatana) Antiochus Hierax: 1 tetradr. (Abydus) Lot B Alexander III: 3 early post. tetradr. (Miletus, Marathus, Tyre) 9 dr. (Asia Minor mints) Lysimachus: 1 lifetime tetradr. (Lampsa- cus) 1 dr. (Ephesus) Carystus: 15 didr.; 8 dr. Euboean League: 236 dr. Athens: 11 tetradr. Seleucus I: 1 dr. (unc.) Antiochus I: 1 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim) Disposition: M. Wallace, Toronto, 286 (Lot B); New York it (ex Robinson, Lot A, nos. 6, 9, 11, 15-16, 25, 30, 32, 37, 43, 90) Robinson, NNM 124 (1952), illus. (Lot A) Wallace, NNM 134 (1956), pp. 50-52
